Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black with traces of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lion's body to right; pendant lozenge as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 267, no. 605)
Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 35, no. 125, pl. 32)
Edgar 1911 / Catalogue Générale des antiquités égyptiennes du musée du Caire, Greek Vases (p. 12, no. 26157)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0597) (phase 2)
